reviews.text: Perfect venue for UES dinner with old friends. Interesting and eclectic menu with many options. Attentive service. Nice lively vibe.
None of the food is sweet and the waiter I had is rude
Good food, good service and good prices.
Incrivelmente espetacular, todos os pratos servidos estavam deliciosos
Terrific brunch. Steve was lovely and attentive. Food superb.
Great local restaurant.  Nothing crazy, but good and friendly service, good food, and decent wine. Solid.

Had a great date night dinner with my boyfriend here. The duck breast entree was delicious and quite generous in size. We also loved the French onion soup! Atmosphere at the restaurant is classy and buzzy on a Saturday night. Will also be back in the future for the bar happy hour! Justin was a really wonderful server - super informative, attentive, and kind.

Came here for an anniversary on a Saturday evening. We ordered cocktails to start. They were delicious and beautifully served with infused ice ball cubes and rosemary sprigs. Appetizer of sausages with mustards. For the main, red wine from Spain, sausage entree, and canard √† l orange. Everything was delicious and the service was top notch, not rushing us to finish our wine. Much appreciated. We will be back! Wonderful experience
Great food and wonderful service! Been here for brunch dinner. Both excellent. Thanks, Steve!

I went with some friends and the experience was wonderful. The food was super fresh, beautifully presented, and most importantly, delicious. One of the best hot oat milk lattes I‚Äôve ever had! I highly recommend this place for anyone looking to celebrate a special occasion or simply enjoy a nice brunch with good friends.

I‚Äôd also like to highlight the excellent service from Gabriel and Mika, as well as the entire staff for making us feel at home. All that‚Äôs left to say is thank you, and we hope to come back soon!
Great food and great service! Shoutout steve our service was lovely!
Ksenia was excellent!!!  She brought my wife a birthday cake and was extremely friendly and professional!!
amazing food and amazing service by Ksenia!

My family, including my 84 year old father (whose birthday we were celebrating), his friend,  husband and 1 and three year old had dinner at Cafe D‚ÄôAlsace last evening. As mentioned already, I have small kiddos. They were doing their best- my three year old coloring and my one year old - being one- wiggling- always hungry without the words to express it- and an unkind woman decided it was appropriate to let me knowing we were disrupting not only her experience at the restaurant but everyone else‚Äôs. She also proceeded to walk past us saying ‚Äúlosers‚Äù, ignore me when o tried to speak with her on her way back from calling us losers, and throw the sweet drawing my three year old handed her on the ground before we headed out.. now that is all to say that while she was awful, the restaurant- the food and care we were given despite being more high maintenance that I would have liked- were amazing! The staff had seen what had happened and treated our family with the utmost care- letting us know that we were welcome there, not just in word but in kindness- crayons for my daughter to use, desert. They made what was an awful encounter very special. While we don‚Äôt go out to eat very often (see small children) we will definitely be back. Thank you all so much for your care. It made a tremendous difference and you have our patronage.

I loved the design of the place, the food was excellent,  but the best part was the service- Ksenia was wonderful, attentive, but not in the annoying way , made great suggestions and did not rush us.
Will definitely be back !

We had a delicious meal this past Saturday night. I had duck breast that was even better than I had in France. My husband had a delicious sausage and pork dish.  We had the apple tart that was amazing.  We also had a beer that was unusual.  It was a lovely experience and we‚Äôll be back on another visit to New York.

The greeters were warm and welcoming, and we were promptly seated at a lovely table just inside, facing outdoors ‚Äî the perfect spot to enjoy a fall morning. The coffee was strong and just what we needed to start the day. Our table ordered the Omelette Maison, Omelette Lorraine, and the Grilled Chicken Club ‚Äî all were flavorful, well-prepared, and made for the perfect start to a beautiful day. The service throughout was attentive and very good, adding to an overall excellent brunch experience.
Busy and fun
Our server, Steve, as well as the amazing bread and house made sorbet were perfection. I can always count on the vibe, food, and service at d‚ÄôAlsace. Over a decade now‚Ä¶
Ksenia our waitress was amazing. Always with a smile and check to see if you're okay just by looking and did not interrupt us. She was great this is how service should be. Thank you Ksenia
Wonderful dinner to celebrate Bastille Day! Kevin was especially attentive.
Great food! Steve was awesome
Great Sunday brunch, we had the crepe souffl√© and the smoked salmon duo and both were delicious. Recommend making a reservation as it can get quite busy!
Kgenia and the rest of the service was amazing. Very accommodating to children
Justin was the best, give him a raise

Dinner was amazing with my friend here. The grilled sea bass was good in every way. The whiskey sour also delivered. I especially liked our server, Luis. He gave us great recommendations and he‚Äôs a really nice guy. I‚Äôm definitely gonna visit this spot more.

Dinner was amazing here! I had the duck special entree and it‚Äôs amazing. Luis, our server, was very attentive. He checked in on us regularly and he‚Äôs extremely friendly. I‚Äôll be requesting him when I‚Äôm here again. Great place overall.

I had a wonderful dinner. This was fantastic. There‚Äôs steak up over. There is absolutely fantastic French onion soup. I‚Äôve had some really good craft IPA beers that weekend service was absolutely fantastic. On the street view. Amazing. Check it out.
We three handfuls of fun had a wonderful Oktoberfest experience with Justin and the rest of the team. Our only gripe is that the fantastic food festival didn‚Äôt stay on the calendar long enough!

Amazing place! It has been renovated recently and I still love the quality of food. Had a lunch with my friends, beef tartar comes with french fries if you order an entree portion. Fresh! Also had a glass of wine, and it was more than enough. Nice staffs.
Love Cafe D‚ÄôAlsace and Ksenia took great care of us, she is the best.
Our waiter Kevin was so great- we loved the special Oktoberfest menu!
The restaurant was great, and the service was amazing. Thank you, Steve, for making our dinner unforgettable.
Great service. Steve was very attentive and kind.
Food was amasing and thanks to Ksenia for the nice service! We had a great time.
Jacqueline is wonderful!
Great food and service.  David M was a great server- friendly and timely.
David was so great! Excellent service
Server was delightful and very helpful
Food was great and Ksenid was an excellent server
Amazing waitress Ksenia made our experience in the city so much better! Excellent service

The food is amazing every time, brunch is full of French inspired perfectly cooked eggs and delicious baked goods. It‚Äôs perfect for a date night out and they are so accommodating of my 2 year old during brunch. Ksenia especially made her feel so welcome and took care of everything! Been going for years and will definitely be coming back.
David M is an outstanding server!!
Great meal with great service from David M
Great food and great service. Steve was our server and he was also great.
Our experience here was fantastic! Our server, Kgenia, was so pleasant, attentive and welcoming. Will definitely be back!
ksenia was wonderful

Where do you go to see friends you haven‚Äôt seen in 30+ years? You go to Cafe D‚ÄôAlsace, that‚Äôs where! Delicious food, attentive staff,  wonderful ambience, and some of the best chocolate croissants this side of the Atlantic. Definitely check it out if you‚Äôre on the Upper East Side of Manhattan - you will not be disappointed.
Delicious food and our server David was amazing!
Thanks -perfect service from David M

Cafe d'Alsace is a fantastic French restaurant on the Upper East Side of Manhattan! I visited for the first time this week with friends, and we had an amazing experience!! The atmosphere inside of Cafe d'Alsace is warm & inviting, and the staff are incredibly kind. Specifically, Edgar took excellent care of my group during our visit! :-) Their food + cocktails are delicious. For drinks, their Smoky Paloma is SO good (I highly recommend if you're looking for something within the realm of a tequila/mezcal base). For food, we all tried their Early Dinner Prix Fixe. For a starter, their Butternut Squash Soupe du Jour was a 10/10. For a main, their Grilled Scottish Salmon was so, so delicious (I added a side of their mashed potatoes as well, which was a great choice)!! For dessert, their Homemade Ice Cream & Sorbet were excellent closures to each of our meals. This is a great spot on the UES, definitely go see them!

Relocated from the corner, the new restaurant is nice. Ebullient atmosphere during this review on a Thursday evening. Booths very narrow for groups of four commensals. The food is exquisite, ranging from heavier dishes to lighter fare. Several beers on tap, including some impressive domestics.

My son and his fiance brought me here for brunch on Mothers Day. The cafe was super cute with dining inside and out. We ate outside. The chef really knows what their doing because everything was amazing and was prepared and cooked to perfection! Plus we couldn't get enough of their fresh bread and preserves üòã

Eggs Benedict here with the bistro ham

First one was cooked to perfection, the second one had less yolk or was cooked more, but overall good egg dip. You can ask for bread from the wait staff!

Came with a light salad of mixed greens and rosemary potatoes. Both were seasoned just right and went well with the eggs benny.

Brioche French toast was fluffy and soft, would highly recommend! The shakshuka was mild for the non-spice members of the party.

Ambiance was nice and cozy, thought it was going to be stiff fancy but it was casual and laid back. Would come back again!

We had the early dinner prix fixe which was super worth it! Food was delicious, cocktails were great and the vibe is approachable but still elevated. Justin took care of our table and he was attentive and friendly, he made sure we had the complete menu and was very educated on the specials.  We‚Äôd love to come back!
Great choucroute garnie! Not something you see over here too often. Fabulous wine list. Great service from Steve. Looking forward to returning.
Amazing dinner and excellent service from Sonia and Luis! They were both very attentive, friendly, and made the evening even more enjoyable. Looking forward to coming back soon!
Make sure to ask for David! He is the sweetest waiter! Recommend getting the burger, frisee salad, and French toast. Also the pastries are to die for.

Amazing cocktails (we had the Aperol spritz and lychee martini) and the club sandwich was divine!! It‚Äôs such a lovely vibe and our server David M was amazing. Will def be back for another brunch with the girls!
What a delicious meal. Tuna tartare. Incredible sauce. Tagliatelle Proven√ßale(not pictured) and brioche dessert with caramelized bananas. Chef‚Äôs kiss.
Food is really good. Service was great great great.  Will be back for Xmas dinner with a group of friends for sure.

Enjoyed a lovely lunch with Long friends during the Restaurant week. Appetizers were great. We enjoyed one of the following: Sammen and Tatta, summer salad with baby spinach, gnocchi with feta, or asparagus soup. All were delicious. Entr√©es he enjoyed the chicken with mashed potatoes, Deliciously cooked fish, Or short ribs. Service with Kevin was fantastic. The food was so delicious and filling that we didn‚Äôt have dessert. We‚Äôll have to go back again.
Stopped by for dessert. The creme br√ªl√©e and crepe souffl√© were amazing! Shout out to Edgar for great service (especially since we needed a birthday candle).

Cafe D''Alsace is the best!! The food is incredible and you will not find better French Onion Soup anywhere, even in Paris. I have been coming here for 17 years and it has stayed just as amazing as when it opened. Beautiful atmosphere and excellent service, always. David M. is an amazing server also!

Had the pleasure of earring at DalSace.  The food and service were outstanding‚Äîespecially the pork chop, which may have been the best. I highly recommend it. The desserts were also excellent. Ask for Gino, great service.
Always a pleasure to dine at Cafe D‚ÄôAlsace. The food is delicious, and the staff is friendly and professional. A special thank you to Sonia, our waitress last night!
Very nice brunch. Service was good. Nice outside seating too. Salad was a bit watery. Excellent fries.
Outdoor ambience is super, except chairs were uncomfortable,  not impressed by cocktail (old fashion Proven√ßal) tasted  like watered down light juice, would come back from apple tart dessert

Service tonight was beyond exceptional. Our server Mika was particularly keen to hon in on the details of our experience by providing in depth recommendations which we took to and greatly and simply enjoyed. The cuisine was exquisite and we will be back as soon as the next opportunity presents itself (tomorrow).
Had a lovely anniversary dinner here, we‚Äôve been many times before and it‚Äôs always our go-to. Steve was amazing!

Incredible food. We were a party of four and not one of us was disappointed. I got the Steak Au Poivre which is a fantastic peppercorn steak and the fries were the best I‚Äôve had all week - perfectly cooked, hot and crispy on the outside. The sauce was flavorful and the steak itself was great. I‚Äôd be happy going back very soon. Only thing that I can remember I wished for was ice with my water so it wasn‚Äôt room-temperature- but if that‚Äôs my biggest grievance, that‚Äôs pretty dang good.

Cafe d‚ÄôAlsace is such a sweet charming spot for brunch on the upper east side.  The food leans towards French, but they also have other brunch super star dishes.  You could honestly find something on the menu for anyone.  I had the crepe souffl√© - it was gorgeous and so light and fluffy!

Jacqueline served us and she was the *bomb dot com* - very warm and knowledgeable about the dishes.

Overall, the experience was so lovely and I would definitely come back!
I didn't believe the reviews. I ate there last night and now I do. The staff treated us like family. The food was to die for. I can't wait to return. Skipping dessert is not an option.

As someone who loves French cuisine, I was curious to try Cafe d'Alsace, so my husband and I went there for dinner on Saturday‚Äîand it exceeded our expectations. The food was absolutely outstanding. All the dishes we ordered were flavorful and perfectly prepared. One highlight was their complimentary bread‚Äîround, with the flavor of cheese bread and the texture of a croissant. It was absolutely delicious!

The restaurant‚Äôs interior was beautifully designed, with elegant colors and furniture that created a cozy yet refined atmosphere.

Service was excellent‚Äîfriendly, attentive, and professional throughout the evening. We're so glad we made a reservation, as it was bustling!

We thoroughly enjoyed our evening at Cafe d‚ÄôAlsace
on the Upper East Side and will definitely be returning soon!

My friends and I had a wonderful experience at Caf√© D‚ÄôAlsace. Everything from the food to the service to the ambience was terrific. Sonia was so kind and helpful with her recommendations. We had a great time!

Had another wonderful dinner again Friday night ( party of 3), food, wine, and service once again perfect. Pork chop for those who desire it, could feed 2 people‚Ä¶huge, tender, and tasty. Kudos to David M for making our evening very pleasant. Have been a long time patron of Jacques, and will continue to have meals there, but Cafe D‚ÄôAlsace has an ambiance that doesn‚Äôt compare. Will be making Cafe D part of our ‚ÄúSupper Club‚Äù rotation. Thank you.

Stopped by for a cosy brunch on a Saturday - the two of us managed to snag a res the evening before, but they did seem Quite busy, so definitely plan ahead!

We ordered eggs benedict and shakshuka to share. We opted for the bistro ham for the eggs benedict and it was very delicious! The eggs were poached very nicely and I really liked the sides (potatoes and salad both very yummy).

Shakshuka was also pretty good, flavour profile with all the spices mixed with the slightly roasted/smokey tomato was nice, would also recommend this dish. I wish they gave more bread hehe

Portion size was fairly big -- we didn't quite finish, but also perhaps our appetites were a bit small -- and I think the overall price point was quite fair for the quality and quantity of food.

That being said, from these two dishes specifically there was nothing that particularly stood out as unique or spectacular in the universe of UES brunch places. I'd be keen to come back to try some other choices!

Food was very average - bone marrow didn't have much marrow, for example. Mussels were very, very tiny.

Our server spilled quite a bit of water when pouring in my glass, but no apologies or attempt to clean up. He made sure we closed the bill when his shift was over, though. Don't think I'll go out of my way to come back.

I had a wonderful dining experience during Restaurant Week. The menu was impressive, and I particularly enjoyed the rich flavors of the pheasant sausage and the delicate seared skate fish. The restaurant's atmosphere was charming, and the staff provided impeccable service. Definitely worth a visit in the future.

Service and atmosphere were fantastic! Chicken and muscles were ok (chicken was dry and the only flavor in the muscles were fishy.
Will 100% come back because of the service and try other dishes!
Nobody gets 5stars since we can all improve.   Grateful for the entire staff!
Delicious appetizer (artichoke soup), entree (steak frites) and drinks (cabernet franc & double espresso with Samubca)! David, our server, was amazing with service! Would recommend Cafe D'Alsace

Service was perfect, food was delicious,  only downside was the restaurant was extremely loud, was hard to have a conversation across the table
Highly recommend the potatoes!
Had an amazing meal! Justin provided excellent recommendations and service, and all the dishes and cocktails were delicious. Spanish octopus and the canard were most notable.
Everything was amazing. The food, the service and the atmosphere. Can‚Äôt wait to come back.

A really lovely French bistro with good Alsatian classics on the menu, and a wide selection of Alsatian wines. A great buzz but not packed. Excellent service. David was the best! We‚Äôll definitely go back and highly recommend.
